pairingText: Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Steak. After all, beef and red wine are a classic combination. Generally, leaner steaks go well with light or medium-bodied reds, such as pinot noir or merlot, while fattier steaks can handle a bold red, such as cabernet sauvingnon. The Taltarni Three Monks Cabernet Merlot with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Taltarni Three Monks Cabernet Merlot
productMatches.description: Taltarni Three Monks is a Cabernet-Merlot blend that combines two very compatible grape varieties sourced from Victoria. It is set to complement Taltarni's reputation for remarkable Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon.The medium-bodied palate is soft, smooth and fills the mouth with ripe berry flavours which are complimented with subtle oak and vanilla. The finish is fresh and clean.Designed for perfect enjoyment on release, it will also reward cellaring. It is an ideal choice matched with lamb veal or your favourite à la Carte meal, such as beef Carpaccio.Blend: 52% cabernet, 48% merlot

pairingText: Malbec, Merlot, and Zinfandel are my top picks for Burger. Merlot will be perfectly adequate for a classic burger with standard toppings. Bolder toppings call for bolder wines, such as a malbec or peppery zinfandel. You could try Marcelo Pelleriti Reserve Malbec. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.
